text: :For the physicist who was involved with the Manhattan Project and later became a faculty member at MIT, see Philip Morrison Philip J. Morrison is an American professor in physics at the University of Texas. He attended the University of California, San Diego, receiving a B.S. in 1972, M.S. in 1974; and Ph.D. in 1979. His interests are in hydrodynamics and plasma physics, including basic nonlinear plasma dynamics, Hamiltonian dynamics of few and infinite degree-of-freedom systems, and fluid mechanics.Faculty and Scientific Staff, University of Texas Institute for Fusion Studies He is a fellow of the American Physical Society.American Physical Society Division of Plasma Physics Fellows ==References== ==External links== *Philip J. Morrison at the University of Texas Category:21st-century American physicists Category:Living people Category:University of California, San Diego alumni Category:University of Texas faculty Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Fellows of the American Physical Society
title: Philip J. Morrison
